metadata.title: CVE-2019-3811 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in sssd. If a user was configured with no homedirectory set, sssd would return '/' (the root directory) instead of ''(the empty string / no home directory). This could impact services thatrestrict the user's filesystem access to within their home directorythrough chroot() etc. All versions before 2.1 are vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3811` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libipa-hbac0 - 2.2.2-1
libnss-sss - 2.2.2-1
libpam-sss - 2.2.2-1
libsss-certmap0 - 2.2.2-1
libsss-idmap0 - 2.2.2-1
libsss-nss-idmap0 - 2.2.2-1
libsss-simpleifp0 - 2.2.2-1
libsss-sudo - 2.2.2-1
python3-libipa-hbac - 2.2.2-1
python3-libsss-nss-idmap - 2.2.2-1
python3-sss - 2.2.2-1
sssd - 2.2.2-1
sssd-ad - 2.2.2-1
sssd-ad-common - 2.2.2-1
sssd-common - 2.2.2-1
sssd-dbus - 2.2.2-1
sssd-idp - 2.2.2-1
sssd-ipa - 2.2.2-1
sssd-kcm - 2.2.2-1
sssd-krb5 - 2.2.2-1
sssd-krb5-common - 2.2.2-1
sssd-ldap - 2.2.2-1
sssd-proxy - 2.2.2-1
sssd-tools - 2.2.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sssd package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.2-1').
